thread.title: Brazilian city's murder rate up 650% after police strike | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Brazilian city's murder rate up 650% after police strike | Daily Mail Online

author: Gareth Davies For Mailonline
title: Brazilian city's murder rate up 650% after police strike | Daily Mail Online
text: Slaughter on the streets: Brazilian city sees its murder rate go up 650% after police go on strike, with 52 murders in just THREE DAYS across lawless region WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT The chaos on the streets of Espírito Santo has been compared to the film The Purge where lawlessness rules Officers have staged a mass walkout since Saturday in a row over their working conditions and their low pay People are running around with guns and machetes and a spate of murders have caused mass panic in Brazil Military troops have been deployed to restore order in city of Vitoria where 52 reported homicides took place Published: 09:27 GMT, 7 February 2017 | Updated: 10:10 GMT, 7 February 2017 57 shares
